class_notes: This course focuses on the principles and techniques of visual storytelling through sequential art. Students will draw objects, figures, and environments from observation and imagination, learning to create the illusion of life, movement, and depth using ink applied with brushes, nib pens, and micron pens. Students will analyze the visual language of sequential art, borrowing tools from a variety of comics, graphic novels and manga. Students will use this language to tell their own stories, both fiction and nonfiction, through comics and narrative drawings.
course_description: This studio art course will offer an opportunity to examine specialized topics across a variety of techniques and media. Topics may include Comic and Sequential Drawing, Sketchbook Drawing, Life Drawing and Painting, Portraiture or Printmaking. Course may be repeated for credit when topic changes, up to a maximum of twelve hours.
